meanings.definition: To act as a junior or apprentice.
meanings.sent1: She juniored at the law firm to learn from experienced lawyers.
meanings.sent2: He juniored under the guidance of a skilled carpenter to improve his woodworking.
meanings.sent3: The young chef juniored in the kitchen, trying not to burn the soup.
meanings.sent4: The new intern juniored alongside the seasoned employees, eager to gain knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The student juniored in the lab, carefully following the scientist's instructions.

meanings.definition: To be in a lower position or rank within a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: She juniored in the company, assisting the senior managers with their tasks.
meanings.sent2: He juniored in the team, supporting the captain during the match.
meanings.sent3: The rookie player juniored on the bench, waiting for his turn to shine.
meanings.sent4: The young officer juniored in the army, following orders from higher-ranking officials.
meanings.sent5: The assistant juniored in the office, helping the supervisors with administrative duties.
